HTMLSelectElement.summary: The HTMLSelectElement interface represents a {{HTMLElement("select")}} HTML Element. These elements also share all of the properties and methods of other HTML elements via the interface.

remarks.para: -The select HTML element, which implements this interface.

HTMLSelectElementAdd.summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.add() method adds an element to the
collection of option elements for this select element.

HTMLSelectElementAutocomplete.summary: The autocomplete property of the interface indicates whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser. It reflects the <select> element's autocomplete attribute.

remarks.para:
-select
-option
-HTML autocomplete attribute
-ARIA aria-autocomplete attribute
-Turning off autocompletion

HTMLSelectElementAutocomplete.value: A string representing the value of the autocomplete attribute ("on", "off", or a <token-list>) or the empty string ("") if unspecified.

HTMLSelectElementCheckValidity.summary: The checkValidity() method of the interface returns a boolean value which indicates if the element meets any constraint validation rules applied to it. If false, the method also fires an event on the element. Because there's no default browser behavior for checkValidity(), canceling this invalid event has no effect.

blockquote.para: An HTML {{htmlelement("select")}} element with a non-null is considered invalid, will match the CSS {{cssxref(":invalid")}} pseudo-class, and will cause checkValidity() to return false. Use the method to set the to the empty string to set the state to be valid.

remarks.para:
-
-textarea
-form
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation
-CSS :valid and :invalid pseudo-classes

HTMLSelectElementCheckValidity.returns: Returns true if the element's value has no validity problems; otherwise, returns false.

HTMLSelectElementDisabled.summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.disabled property is a boolean value that reflects the
disabled
HTML attribute, which indicates whether the control is disabled. If it is disabled, it
does not accept clicks. A disabled element is unusable and un-clickable.

HTMLSelectElementForm.summary: The form read-only property of the interface returns an object that owns this {{htmlelement("select")}}, or null if this select is not owned by any form.

remarks.para:
-
-
-select
-HTML form attribute
-HTML forms guide

HTMLSelectElementItem.summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.item() method returns the
corresponding to the whose
position in the options list corresponds to the index given in the parameter, or
null if there are none.

remarks.para:
In JavaScript, using the array bracket syntax with an unsigned long, like
selectElt[index] is equivalent to
selectElt.namedItem(index).
- that implements it.

HTMLSelectElementLabels.summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.labels read-only property returns a
of the {{HTMLElement("label")}} elements associated with the
select element.
HTMLSelectElementLabels.value:
A containing the <label> elements associated
with the <select> element.

HTMLSelectElementLength.summary: The length property of the interface specifies the number of {{htmlelement("option")}} elements in the {{htmlelement("select")}} element. It represents the number of nodes in the collection. On setting, it acts as ().

remarks.para:
-select
-option
-
-
-
-

HTMLSelectElementMultiple.summary: The multiple property of the interface specifies that the user may select more than one option from the list of options. It reflects the {{htmlelement("select")}} element's multiple attribute.

remarks.para:
-select
-
-
-

HTMLSelectElementName.summary: The name property of the interface indicates the name of the {{HTMLElement("select")}} element. It reflects the element's name attribute.
HTMLSelectElementName.value: A string representing the element's name.

HTMLSelectElementNamedItem.summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.namedItem() method returns the
corresponding to the
whose name or id match the specified name, or
null if no option matches.

remarks.para: In JavaScript, using selectElt.namedItem('value') is equivalent to selectElt.options.namedItem('value').
- that implements it.

HTMLSelectElementOptions.summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.options read-only property returns
a of the {{HTMLElement("option")}} elements
contained by the select element.
HTMLSelectElementOptions.value:
A containing the <option>
elements contained by the <select> element.

HTMLSelectElementRemove.summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.remove() method removes the element
at the specified index from the options collection for this select element.

remarks.para:
-, the method that gets called when remove is called
without arguments on a .
- that implements it.

HTMLSelectElementReportValidity.summary: The reportValidity() method of the interface performs the same validity checking steps as the method. In addition, if the event is not canceled, the browser displays the problem to the user.

remarks.para:
-
-select
-form
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation
-CSS :valid and :invalid pseudo-classes

HTMLSelectElementReportValidity.returns: Returns true if the element's value has no validity problems; otherwise, returns false.

HTMLSelectElementRequired.summary: The required property of the interface specifies that the user must select an option with a non-empty string value before submitting a form. It reflects the {{htmlelement("select")}} element's required attribute.

remarks.para:
-select
-
-:required pseudo-class

HTMLSelectElementSelectedIndex.summary: The selectedIndex property of the interface is the numeric index of the first selected {{HTMLElement("option")}} element in a {{HTMLElement("select")}} element, if any, or −1 if no <option> is selected. Setting this property selects the option at that index and deselects all other options, while setting it to -1 deselects any currently selected options.

HTMLSelectElementSelectedOptions.summary:
The read-only property
selectedOptions contains a list of the
option elements contained within the select
element that are currently selected. The list of selected options is an
object with one entry per currently selected option.

remarks.para:
An option is considered selected if it has an
attribute.
-Drop-down controls

HTMLSelectElementSelectedOptions.value:
An which lists every currently selected
which is either a child of the
or of an within the
<select> element.In other words, any option contained within the <select> element may
be part of the results, but option groups are not included in the list.If no options are currently selected, the collection is empty and returns a
of 0.

HTMLSelectElementSetCustomValidity.summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.setCustomValidity() method sets the
custom validity message for the selection element to the specified message. Use the
empty string to indicate that the element does not have a custom validity
error.

remarks.para: -Form validation.

HTMLSelectElementShowPicker.summary: The HTMLSelectElement.showPicker() method displays the browser picker for a select element.

remarks.para: This is the same picker that would normally be displayed when the element is selected, but can be triggered from a button press or other user interaction.

-select
-
-

HTMLSelectElementSize.summary: The size property of the interface specifies the number of options, or rows, that should be visible at one time. It reflects the {{htmlelement("select")}} element's size attribute. If omitted, the value is 0.

blockquote.para: While by default a <select> displays a single row unless is true, in which case four rows are displayed, the default value for the size property is 0.

remarks.para:
-select
-option
-
-

HTMLSelectElementType.summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.type
read-only property returns the form control's type.

remarks.para: -The select HTML element, implementing this interface.

HTMLSelectElementValidationMessage.summary: The validationMessage read-only property of the interface returns a string representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints that the {{htmlelement("select")}} control does not satisfy (if any). This is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation ( is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

remarks.para: If the <select> element is a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is true) and the constraints are not met (the object's valid property is false), the value is the error message that would be shown to the user during validation.

-select
-
-
-
-
-
-
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation
-CSS :valid and :invalid pseudo-classes

HTMLSelectElementValidity.summary: The validity read-only property of the interface returns a object that represents the validity states this element is in.

remarks.para:
-
-select
-form
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation

HTMLSelectElementValue.summary: The HTMLSelectElement.value property contains the value of the first selected option element associated with this select element.

remarks.para: This property can also be set directly, for example to set a default value based on some condition.
-The select HTML element, implementing this interface.

HTMLSelectElementValue.value: A string containing the value of the first selected option element in this select element, or the empty string if no options are selected.

HTMLSelectElementWillValidate.summary: The willValidate read-only property of the interface indicates whether the {{htmlelement("select")}} element is a candidate for constraint validation. It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation, such as when its property is true.

remarks.para:
-
-select
-form
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation
